It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family, which includes many species of ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Appendicula perplexa is considered endangered and is of great interest to botanists and conservationists.
